author: ogel646
title: good for a pirates fan
review:
The box says this set includes 6 figures,however,it just contains 5 real figures because one of them is a skeleton.

This set is also a expensive set,considering it only has 310 pieces.Anyway,some of the pieces are worthy to have,here's a list about this set:

Pros:
Exclusive female pirate
Great animals such as crab,fish,parrot,and 2 snakes
No sticker at all!All patterns are printed
The captain pirate and soldiers 
Cool weapons
Other nice accessories,such as bridge,flag,cannon...

Cons:
Should be $35,not $40
More soldiers needed

Overall,this is still a good set but can not deserve a 5/5

author: donneyboy
title: arrg pirates be a huntin'
review:
i got this set today, and for those who dont know it is $39.99 USD. i got this set at my TRU, which is the place for 2009 sets. first off the figures are great. you get 5- the skeleton is not a minifig. the figures are captain brickbeard, a generic pirate,a pirate wench, and two british redcoats. the wench is awesome! and the british gaurds are sweet also, they have printed packs on their backs as well. it includes 3 bags of parts. bag 1 is the minifigs, the boat, and the front of the ship. bag 2 is the rock, and cabin. and bag 3 is the back, and mast. here is what i think the pros and cons are- 
pros- 
great structure
pirate wench
dark blue boats
no dds ( dreaded sticker sheet)
new fish
captain brickbeard
cannon!

cons- 
could have a flag on the mast
none others. 

BTW this is a limited edition set. 

overall i give this a 5/5

author: rEV300
title: got it for chrictmas and its awesome
review:
Got this set for christmas and the minifigures are awesome.

    cons:
         it should have fire for the cannon.
  

    pros:it comes with alot of men.
         the broken ship is cool.
         it comes with alot of extra pieces.

author: mountainbricks
title: Hooray for rolling skulls!
review:
There is much controversy about the new Pirates, but this is one of the best sets.
Pros: 
Rolling Skull Heads (though how would it stop the soldiers?...)
Clever design and lots of accessories: snakes, crab, skeleton, weapons
Swinging blade is OK

Cons:
Not many pieces for price
Soldier Captain's head (Rascus) is overused in all the sets
Bridge doesn't work well

This was the first set I grabbed, and it's a great one.

author: pdcarson
title: Great set, great pieces
review:
Before I get down to the pro and con list I've got to say this set has some great out of the ordinary pieces, from the logs, to the arcs used to make the ships skeleton, to the bridge.  All the pieces are great additions to any ones collections.  As for the set traditional build its a 8/10  not the best but very original none the less.

Playability 10/10  perfect mini complement 2 Imperial and 3 pirates with a skelly thrown in for good measure not to mention all the "traps" the set has.

Pros
-good mini figure count (5 and 1 Skelly)
-Female Pirate
-Pirate Captain
-Bridge is a nice touch
-spare sword and oar.

Cons
-not enough treasure for the chest (I always have this bone to pick though)
-the snakes bug me they seems like a non-LEGO toy thrown in for no real reason (Consider the fish, it has a lego quality to it the snakes - not at all)
-Price is just wee bit high - but still within range of being a good value

Overall 9.7/10 - great pieces, great minis, great complement to any pirate collection, good model.

author: CCOOK
title: Cool
review:
Good set - can't really complain about anything except that lego doesn't like using the nice old baseplates - would've been nice to have a 32x32 stud blue baseplate with this set, but oh well.

It looks like a shipwreck which is cool, the cabin is nice, the flag looks really good (best pirate flag there is), the minifigures are detailed.  Wish it would have come with one of those new big sharks like the Brickbeard Bounty.

author: jinxjinx550
title: Best of the New Pirate Sets
review: One of the things I really appreciate about the new pirate sets is the wealth of pieces in new colors they bring.  I was really happy to get a bunch of new dark brown stockade/log pieces as well as some slopes in this set.  Pirate sets are great in that they enable you to combine them into new interesting constructions for Castle, Forestmen, Harry Potter, and even some of the Japanese mecha settings.  It's a real plus -- the gift that keeps on giving!

author: jonbuddy
title: "I don't get it Captain, why are we going to a shipwreck?" "Well, scouts have told us that it's a Shipwreck Hideout."
review:
Awesome set. Worth it's price of $39.99, while I personally think that the Soldier's Fort is not worth $49.99.

Good:
Captain Redbeard
Pirate Wench
Pirate
Admiral
Armada Captain
Pirate Flag
Crow's Nest
Loaded Treasure Chest
Skeleton Head x3
Fish
Snakes in the Water x2
Rare Bridge
Really looks like a Shipwreck
Crab (Awesome)
Skeleton Captain
Rifles
Newer type of Pistols
Telescopes

Bad:
Bridge has to be turned manually

Overall:
5/5
or
10/10

author: DevDevBeck
title: Amazing new lego Pirates Set
review:
This is an excellent new LEGO set. In my lifetime, i have never come in contact with a pirate set, so this is my first pirate set. 6253 comes with 2 British soldiers, 3 pirates, a treasure chest, a rowboat, a parrot and many more features.
   Shipwreck Hideout is a great example of how clever the people at LEGO are, especially with the ships keel and supporters. 6253 includes a female pirate with Agent Trace's hair, A captain, and a regular pirate. There is also a commander British soldier, and his officer.
   The mast is pretty simple. Just take the mast (all one piece) and put the Barrel on top using some technic pieces. The bridge is an extremely rare piece, and it uses a pull stick to make it collapse. 
   A massive shipwreck is also included with this set. the hull veins appear to be intact, but almost all of the deck was lost to nature. The captains cabin is what the title says, it's a captains cabin. Inside is a desk with a treasure map, a cup, and a pile of sculls. The desk can be moved so the captain can send the skulls to the outside world. On the roof of the cabin is a cannon with a pretty cool pirate flag. Underneath he cabin is a booby trap and a treasure chest. Although not visible in the picture, there is a ship wheel behind the cabin on the keelline floor.
   The last part of the shipwreck hideout os th english boat. The minifigures are cool, but the boat is pretty basic.
   Remember, this is a limited edition set and is likely to go off store shelves soon, so get yours now!
DevDev

author: jakelongdragon
title: Yo-ho-ho and a treasure of bricks!
review:
"This a great booty for any Pirate fans of Legos.

First this set is as filled with traps and adventure fun as the Indiana Jones series. These traps include a swinging sword area, a hidden cache with rolling skeleton heads, and a flipping bridge. The main hideout is ship cabin with a nice door, windows and a table. The bridge links the cabin to a ship mast and lookout. Those great features make this Pirate set a step above the rest. It is lots of fun both to build and play with and there an infinite way to re-arrange the traps and the various parts of the hideouts.

Another great treasure comes from the huge variety of rare and special pieces and the awesome minifigs. Any lego sea rover will love the shipmast with a lookout area, steering wheel, ship rib pieces, jolly roger and redcoat flags, boat dinghies and a bridge in one piece, as well as all the pirate-related weapons (3 rifles, 3 swords and 2 guns) and tons of accessories. 

The minifigs are really beautiful especially Brickbeard (the lego pirate captain). Brickbeard is just awesome-looking with his peg leg, hook hand, and eyepatch. He wears a really nice captain costume and a hat with a jolly roger. There is also a female pirate (with an eyepatch as well), a regular pirate crew, a redcoat officer with a tricorn hat, a redcoat soldier with a tall hat and a skeletion. All minifigs are printed both front and back and are very detailed!

Lego Pirates sets are a bit pricey but they are as nice looking and full of details as Lego Castle and as much fun as Indiana Jones sets so they are really worth it; and the Shipwreck hideout is really the best deal of the series for the fun and the money.

Arrr! Mateys! This is a pirate life for everyone!"

author: SaintElsewhere
title: YAAARRRR!
review: I ordered this from S@H before X-mas and received it today. I like the traps and the number of figs included, plus there's a skeleton thrown in as an extra. I like that the set uses several pieces not seen in several years, including the rope bridge, parrot, headgear, crab, and rowboat. The construction is somewhat complex thanks to the traps, but the instructions still make it easy to understand. I am a little upset with the fact that the global recession is affecting Lego prices, but I can live with it as long as it doesn't get TOO outrageous. (For example 112 pieces for $74.99.)

author: JBH75
title: The Pirate's Base (in a shipwreck)
review:
This set was really cool, and a limited edition. When I saw it I had to have it, but the price was, pricey!

Pros:
Pirate Wench and Brickbeard
Crab, fish, snakes, parrot
Skeleton and four other skull heads
Cool traps
Nice pirate flag (skull and bones looks cartoony, but I draw so whatever)
Tricorner hat with red plume
Swinging Bridge
Firing Cannon
Sturdy Mast with Crows Nest
Treasure in a gold chest

Cons:
Like I said Pricey
No Fierce Animal. I'd have loved to get a shark! (Which can eat minifigs and lots of fish)
Hardly any Cabin room
Really wanted a shark!

As you can see there are lots of pros but watch those cons. Hopefully in the future lego will bring other cool set. Hopefully with a shark!!
This set is up in my top 10 list.

author: lotographia
title: Deadly skulls.
review:
I know she'll inevitably turn up in the Pirate-themed advent calendar, thus making her no longer rare, but for the time being it's great to have the unique pirate woman. Really, whoever at Lego decided that there should be a female pirate deserves a promotion.

This set goes great with 'kraken attack' - it's easy to imagine that the raft was built out of the same shipwreck as this fort was. Really, this set shows great imagination - the remnants of the shipwreck you can find around the place make the whole thing come to life.

The only real problem with it is that the bridge doesn't topple over on its own. You can pull the pin out but it doesn't do anything. The only reason I don't take a point off because of this is because I'm more interested in the toy as a model than as a playset, and even then tipping the bridge over on your own isn't too much of a hassle.

Oh, and why doesn't the cannon have a ramrod? It's easy, all you need is an antenna. Could be grey, could be black, it doesn't matter. But whatever. I love the set too much to worry about these minor details and I've got enough antennas in my collection to just borrow one.

A++ would buy again.

author: Marcus_Clinton
title: One of my favorite sets
review:
I just put this together and it is really great, I love the piratey feel of the set. My favorite thing about the pirate sets is how well they fit together. There is a small indent in the side of the loot island (which I also picked up today) baseplate and the front of this ship fits in perfectly making it look like the ship crashed on the island.

Pros:
Pirate Wench :D
Cool Design
Awesome traps and special parts
Fun to play with

Cons:
2 soldiers verses 3 pirates and a dead skeleton who are fully armed with guns, swords, a cannon and traps is a bit unfair (Needs at least 1 more soldier or a cannon or something)

author: hustla187
title: Good but Not as Good as the Original Sets
review: When I first heard that Lego was reviving the Pirates line, I was excited. However, these new sets didn't live up to the hype. I don't like the fact that Captain Redbeard isn't included which is not cool. However, I do like the skeleton and the gold treasure chest. The bridge that falls apart has already been used in past sets and it's getting old by now. This set can be described as a failure for Lego and ruined the Pirates theme.

author: Pepper
title: one of the nicest 2009 pirates sets out there
review:
I got this set at Toys 'R' Us, earlier this year with Christmas money. This set has 5 minifigures, well, 6 including the skeleton. The minifigures are, 2 British soldiers and 3 pirates. The accessories are cool. They are: 4 cutlasses (pirate swords), 2 pirate pistols, 3 shotguns, a telescope, a golden goblet, a map, a golden treasure chest with treasure, a fish, a crab, a parrot, and 2 snakes. The model itself is quite cool. It has cool features such as, a firing cannon, swinging bridge, sword trap, skull trap, crow's nest, and steering wheel among others.

pros:
-minifigures
-accessories
-very nice hideout
-British boat

cons:
-price (should be $30 instead of $40)
-not enough space in the cabin

Overall, a pretty good set. I reccommend it to any LEGO fan. Get it while you can!

author: chrisdog121411
title: Awsome set!!
review:
I recently got this in january. It took me 2:30pm -3:45pm to build.
My little brother just loves it. I also got 8396, and 8397 to go with this.


pros and cons


6 minifigs

boat

sneaks

easy to use insturctions

not long build

author: Demons_to_death
title: A Pirate GIRL!!
review:
like you saw I was happy to get my hands on some more this lego set is actually Pretty COOL!!

with the 2 British soilders and ANOTHER Pirate Commander!!

And it came with a Pirate GIRL!! don't they believe in Bad luck a female on Board is bad luck!!

author: tictaco
title: Need more space!
review: OK, the set i nice with the minifigs and the details ( esspecialy the soldiers bote) but the space is not enough... I made a custom designe of my own including all the original pieces and a very small amount of bricks which everybody has. The thing different from the original is that I extended the cabin and rearanged the lower part of the hideout to become a base for the other 2 pirates ( never touched the sweet lookout post) . So i ended with a bigger room for the captain and a really cool place for the other pirates, although i had to ruin the stupid launcher it was worth it.

author: LobsterWarrior
title: Da Secret Fort......(Yes, spelt it wrong on purpose)
review:
We get a cannon, a parrot, a fish, a skeleton.a crab, and two snakes. Anyways, the hideout is amazing! The pirates can completley crush the soldiers without being spotted! Very very very roomy. I got this set about Christmas two years ago. The cannon fires FAR, seriously far. The bridge piece is VERY nice. Now, how could the two scouting soldiers defeat three hidden and ready pirates? Without other sets, the soldiers are demolished. Onto the pros and cons!

Pros:

  • Five figs! Three pirates and two soldiers.
  • Girl Pirate!
  • AWESOME HIDEOUT!
  • Cannon fires far
  • Cool bridge piece!
  • All the traps work well!

Cons:

  • Like I mentioned, the soldiers are gonna get demolished with only two of them and three ready and ready to trap them and only two of them!
  • Again, only two soldiers!
  • Same Brickbeard from 4 other sets..

Well, that's it! :P. If you didn't buy this, then it's alright, there will be more limited-edition AWESOME sets! :).

author: SirSven7
title: Lego Steve's Review
review:
Now we come to some of the bigger sets, this one was a limited release and actually sold very quickly in England. The set lacks a baseplate (which is a real shame) but was very cheap for its size and included a lot of nice ideas.

If you remember back to 1996 when they had the shipwreck set and I said how it just looked stupid, well here we have something similar, but the set is good. The tower on the right is perfect and the cabin though small is still really nice (the corroded ribs of the hull look good too), and the imperials also get an officer (they only came in the bigger sets).

I am not such a fan of the traps they included (some skulls to drop down a hole and a scythe type thing) but then again the set is aimed at children so playability has to be included. Give this set a baseplate and I would rate it up there with the old Imperial Outpost or Lagoon Lock Up, a very nice set.

If you like this review click on the link to find it and all reviews of the pirate sets

http://legosteveblog.blogspot.com/2011/04/lego-pirate-wave-5-2009-2010.html
